org.netbeans.spi.search

Class SearchScopeDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.spi.search.SearchScopeDefinition

  • public abstract class SearchScopeDefinition
extends Object
    Interface for obtaining information about scope of a search task. Instances are created by SearchScopeDefinitionProvider every time new Search dialog is opened.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SearchScopeDefinition()

      Get priority of this search scope.

      Returns object defining the actual search scope, i.e.
      abstract String getTypeId()
      Identifies type of search scope.
      abstract boolean isApplicable()
      Is this search scope applicable at the moment? For example, search scope of all open projects is not applicable if there is no open project.

      This method should be called whenever the state of current search scope changes.

      • SearchScopeDefinition

        public SearchScopeDefinition()

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeId

        @NonNull
public abstract String getTypeId()
        Identifies type of search scope.

      • getDisplayName

        @NonNull
public abstract String getDisplayName()
        Returns human-readable, localized name of this search scope.
        Returns:
        name of this search scope

      • getAdditionalInfo

        @CheckForNull
public String getAdditionalInfo()
        Returns an additional information about this search scope. This information may (but may not) be displayed by the scope's display name, possibly rendered using a different font (style, colour). The default implementation returns null.
        Returns:
        string with the additional information, or null if no additional information is available

      • isApplicable

        public abstract boolean isApplicable()
        Is this search scope applicable at the moment? For example, search scope of all open projects is not applicable if there is no open project.
        Returns:
        true if this search scope is applicable, false otherwise

      • addChangeListener

        public final void addChangeListener(@NonNull
                                    ChangeListener l)
        Registers a listener listening for changes of applicability. Registered listeners should be notified each time this SearchScope changes.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to be registered
        See Also:
        isApplicable()

      • removeChangeListener

        public final void removeChangeListener(@NonNull
                                       ChangeListener l)
        Unregisters a listener listening for changes of applicability. If the passed listener is not currently registered or if the passed listener is null, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to be unregistered
        See Also:
        addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener), isApplicable()

      • notifyListeners

        protected final void notifyListeners()
        This method should be called whenever the state of current search scope changes.

      • getSearchInfo

        @NonNull
public abstract SearchInfo getSearchInfo()
        Returns object defining the actual search scope, i.e. the iterator over FileObjects to be searched.
        Returns:
        SearchInfo defining the search scope

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getPriority

        public abstract int getPriority()
        Get priority of this search scope. The lower priority - the higher position in the combo box.

      • clean

        public abstract void clean()
        This method is called when this search scope definition is no longer needed.

      • selected

        public void selected()
        This method is called when the search scope is selected in the UI. Default implementation does nothing.

      • getIcon

        @CheckForNull
public Icon getIcon()
        Get icon to show in the combo box. The default implementation returns null.
        Returns:
        The icon, or null.
        Since:
        api.search/1.10
